abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Fourth Flood Control and
            Drainage (FCD) Project for Bangladesh were as follows:
            outcomes were satisfactory, project sustainability was
            uncertain, Bank performance was satisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons learned
            included: land acquisition compensations should be fair and
            based on market studies of prevailing land values and the
            land acquisition system itself ought to be carefully planned
            and the bureaucratic process should be initiated before
            project appraisal or negotiations. Detailed designs of key
            works should be undertaken before appraisal. FCD projects
            need to be carefully planned taking due note of possible
            environmental consequences (such as reduced fish production
            and higher flood water elsewhere) and be designed to include
            specific measures to mitigate them. Preparation of an
            appropriate O&M plan, adequate funding for its
            implementation and strengthening Bangladesh Water
            Development Board's (BWDB's) Operating and
            Maintaining (O&M) institutional capacities are essential
            to ensure sustainability of water-sector investments.
